title: OMB: 2019 Back Pay Law Doesn't Cover Furloughed Workers Amid Shutdown
snippets: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees that federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not apply to furloughed workers.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxQeTdNcElLQ2hOX1pDXzdzZktyX2t2M2lheUM5YlMxZ0sxODRybHJWMXpaeW1OU3EzbWp4ZFRhYjcwV0lYY1lsTkhDdEtpeGx3Z2FTM3RJMUpPRUJ0MTZsYVlJMUtxU2pucWlLbXBtY1NPRWNDODZjNDlkdXZjd1hxUWRYRjQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Scoop: White House memo says furloughed federal

OMB argues an amendment to a 2019 act would not guarantee furloughed workers post-shutdown pay

The White House’s office of management and budget (OMB) is arguing that federal workers who are furloughed amid the ongoing government shutdown are not entitled to back pay.

In a draft memo
As the federal shutdown stretches on, furloughed federal workers face the threat of not receiving back pay, despite a 2019 law that requires it.
titles: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law
Congress erupts over "lawless" Trump threat not to pay back furloughed federal workers - Axios
Scoop: White House memo says furloughed federal workers aren't entitled to backpay - Axios
White House says furloughed federal workers not entitled to back pay amid shutdown
Furloughed federal workers face threat of no back pay from shutdown, despite 2019 law requiring it
summary: The White House's Office of Management and Budget (OMB) contends that a 2019 law ensuring federal employees receive back pay after a shutdown does not apply to furloughed workers. This interpretation has sparked controversy amid the ongoing government shutdown, leaving furloughed federal employees at risk of not getting back pay as previously guaranteed by the 2019 legislation.

title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics Awarded for Quantum Tech Advances
snippets: The Nobel committee said that the laureates' work provides opportunities to develop "the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors."
John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis have won the 2025 physics Nobel Prize for their work in quantum mechanics. It is the second Nobel Prize to be awarded this year.
The 2025 Nobel prize in physics has gone to John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis, whose work has led to the development of today's quantum computers
John Clarke, Michel H. Devoret, and John Martinis built an electrical circuit-based oscillator on a microchip.
titles: The Nobel Prize for physics is awarded for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling
Nobel Prize in physics goes to US-based trio for discoveries in quantum mechanics
Nobel prize for physics goes to trio behind quantum computing chips
2025 Nobel Prize in Physics awarded for macroscale quantum tunneling
summary: John Clarke, Michel Devoret, and John Martinis were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics for their pioneering work in quantum mechanics, specifically advancing the development of quantum technology, including quantum computers, cryptography, and sensors. Their research has been crucial in demonstrating how quantum mechanics' properties can have practical applications in technology. The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm announced the award, highlighting the trio's contributions as foundational to digital technology's future.

title: McGregor Ineligible for UFC Till March 2026 After Missing Drug Tests
snippets: Conor McGregor accepts an 18-month ban for violating the UFC's anti-doping policy, the organisation says.
Irish superstar Conor McGregor has been handed an 18-month suspension for violating the UFC’s anti-doping policy.

• Former champion missed three tests last year

  • Irishman could return for 2026 bout at White House

Conor McGregor has been handed an 18-month suspension for violating the UFC’s anti-doping policy after missing three attempted tests last year, Combat Sports Anti
Conor McGregor will be ineligible to compete in any UFC event until March 2026.
titles: Conor McGregor given 18-month ban for missing drug tests
Conor McGregor cops 18-month ban for violating UFC’s anti-doping policy
Conor McGregor given 18-month ban for breaking UFC’s anti-doping rules
McGregor accepts 18-month UFC sanction for anti-doping violation
summary: Conor McGregor, after missing three drug tests in 2024 on June 13, September 19, and September 20, will be ineligible to compete in UFC events until March 2026, despite his suspension ending before the UFC White House card next summer.

title: Jerry Jones Considers Appealing Fine for Accidental Obscene Gesture
snippets: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones has been fined $250,000 by the NFL for his "inadvertent" obscene gesture toward fans at MetLife Stadium on Sunday.
The Cowboys' owner may appeal the fine
Social media videos of Jones at the Cowboys-Jets matchup on Sunday appeared to show the owner flashing his middle finger at fans before pointing at them.
titles: Cowboys' Jones fined $250K by NFL for gesture
Jerry Jones fined $250,000 for 'unfortunate gesture' to Jets fans during Cowboys' Week 5 win
Cowboys Owner Jerry Jones Fined $250,000 For Flashing Middle Finger
summary: Dallas Cowboys owner Jerry Jones stated his obscene gesture towards fans at MetLife Stadium was accidental, intending a "thumbs up" during a 37-22 win over the New York Jets. Jones may appeal the fine imposed for the incident.

summary: The Supreme Court is reviewing a case that examines if states have the authority to regulate conversations between counselors and clients, specifically focusing on the legality of conversion therapy bans. This case has ignited a conflict between conservative Christian groups and the LGBTQ+ community, with significant implications for both freedom of speech and the rights of LGBTQ+ individuals. The outcome is pending.

title: Tesla Launches Cheaper Model Y and 3, Prices Start at $36,990
snippets: The electric carmaker’s new model comes as part of efforts to address slumping sales.
Elon Musk has said his automaker would sell an affordable Model Y, as “people don’t have enough money in the bank account to buy it” despite high demand.
The long-awaited cheaper Model 3 and Model Y are finally here, but they start at $36,990 and $39,990, respectively -- just a few thousand dollars less than Tesla's current offerings.
titles: Tesla unveils new lower-cost Model Y amid rising competition
Tesla Unveils Cheaper Model Y And Model 3—Countering Tax Credit Loss
Tesla reveals slightly cheaper ‘standard’ versions of the Model 3 and Model Y
summary: Elon Musk announced Tesla will sell more affordable versions of the Model Y to meet high demand, acknowledging the current price is too high for many consumers. The cheaper trims of the Model Y and Model 3 are now available, starting at $39,990 and $36,990, respectively. These prices, while lower, remain closer to $40,000, slightly missing the mass-market target price of under $30,000 that investors hoped for.

title: Mayor-Elect of Herdecke Stabbed; Chancellor Condemns Attack
snippets: Chancellor Friedrich Merz says "we fear for the life" of Iris Stalzer, a newly-elected mayor in the western town of Herdecke.
Chancellor Friedrich Merz condemns 'heinous attack' after Iris Stalzer, mayor-elect of Herdecke, stabbed.
Iris Stalzer, the incoming mayor of Herdecke, was found stabbed in her home, officials said. It was initially unclear whether it had been a targeted attack.
titles: German mayor critically injured in stabbing attack, police say
German mayor-elect gravely wounded in stabbing attack
Mayor-Elect in Critical Condition After Stabbing in Western Germany
summary: Iris Stalzer, the mayor-elect of Herdecke, was stabbed in her home. Chancellor Friedrich Merz condemned the attack as heinous. The motive behind the stabbing is currently unclear, including whether it was a targeted attack.

title: McGregor Ineligible for UFC Till March 2026 After Missing Drug Tests
snippets: Conor McGregor received an 18-month suspension from UFC anti-doping program Combat Sports Anti-Doping (CSAD) on Tuesday.
McGregor's suspension ends before the UFC White House card next summer

Conor McGregor suspended 18 months for UFC anti-doping violation
summary: Conor McGregor, after missing three drug tests in 2024 on June 13, September 19, and September 20, will be ineligible to compete in UFC events until March 2026, despite his suspension ending before the UFC White House card next summer.

title: EU Plans to Double UK Steel Tariff, Matching Trump's Rates
snippets: The EU is the destination for 78% of steel products made in the UK for overseas markets.

Starmer says UK in discussions with EU over Brussels plan to double import tariff to 50%, which unions warn could kill UK steel industry

The EU has announced it will match Donald Trump’s steel tariffs, doubling levies on imports to 50% in a decision condemned as “an existential threat” to t
titles: EU steel tariff hike threatens 'biggest ever crisis' for UK industry
EU plan to match Trump steel tariffs spurs ‘existential threat’ to UK steel industry
summary: The EU, receiving 78% of the UK's overseas steel exports, plans to double its import tariff to 50%, matching former US President Trump's rates. UK's Labour leader, Starmer, confirms discussions with the EU about this increase, which unions fear could devastate the UK steel industry.

title: Troops Enter Chicago Amid Legal Battles with City and State
snippets: Troops arrive despite active legal challenges from Chicago and the state of Illinois in the courts.

Military presence comes after judge declined to block troops from entering, following lawsuit filed by city and state

  • US
titles: US National Guard troops arrive in Illinois as Trump escalates crackdown

summary: Troops have arrived in Chicago despite ongoing legal challenges from both the city and the state of Illinois. This development follows a judge's decision not to prevent the military's entry, a decision made in the context of a lawsuit brought by Chicago and Illinois.

title: Israel-Hamas Negotiations Begin in Egypt Amid Mourning
snippets: Donald Trump says a Middle East peace deal is “very close,” while pledging US security guarantees for Gaza.
As Israelis brace for a day of mourning and commemoration, negotiators for Israel and Hamas met with mediators in Egypt to hash out an end to the war.
titles: Trump: US-Israel ‘very close to making a deal’ on Gaza peace plan
Israel and Hamas Meet in Egypt to Discuss Gaza Peace Plan
summary: Negotiators from Israel and Hamas have begun indirect talks in Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt, aimed at ending the Israel-Gaza war. The talks, urged by Trump to proceed quickly, coincide with a day of mourning in Israel. The negotiations are facilitated by mediators in an effort to reach a resolution.

title: Macron Under Pressure Amid French Government Collapse and Debt Concerns
snippets: President Emmanuel Macron under pressure as parliamentary paralysis persists.

The collapse of yet another French government over its inability to bring austerity measures through parliament is raising fears that the debt of the EU's second-largest economy is spinning out of control.
titles: How to fix France’s deepening political crisis?
Could France's political turmoil spark eurozone debt crisis?
summary: President Emmanuel Macron faces increased pressure due to ongoing parliamentary paralysis, following the collapse of another French government. This failure to pass austerity measures has heightened concerns over the control of the EU's second-largest economy's debt.

title: Cardinals Fine Coach Gannon $100K for Actions Toward RB Demercado
snippets: The coach was irate after Demercado dropped the ball before crossing the goal line

title: Bettman Hesitant on NHL Olympic Break, Sees Value in Participation

That said, he obviously sees the value.

summary: Israelis marked the second anniversary of the Hamas-led attacks on 7 October, which resulted in approximately 1,200 deaths and 251 kidnappings. Commemorations took place across the country, including rallies in Tel Aviv advocating for the release of hostages still held in Gaza. Concurrently, ceasefire negotiations are underway in Egypt as fighting persists.

title: Badenoch Pledges Deficit Reduction if Conservatives Win Next UK Election
snippets: Leader will pitch Conservatives as the party of spending control with pledge to drive down Britain’s deficit
Kemi Badenoch will vow to cut the UK deficit if the Conservatives win the next general election, as she seeks to recover her party’s claim to sound stewardship of the economy.
titles: Badenoch tries to revive Tory fortunes with plan to boost UK economy
Badenoch Vows to Slash UK Deficit as Tories Focus on Economy
summary: Kemi Badenoch, a Conservative leader, has pledged to reduce the UK's deficit if her party wins the next general election. This move aims to reassert the Conservatives' reputation for economic management.

title: Hackers Steal Data on 8,000 Children from Kido Nursery, Two Arrested
snippets: Hackers were said to have stolen the photographs, names and addresses of about 8,000 children.

Hackers stole names and photos of 8,000 children from Kido nursery chain and posted 10 profiles with threat to publish more

A man and a boy have been arrested in connection with an alleged cyber-attack on a set of nurseries in Greater London.

The man, 22, and boy, 17, were arrested on
titles: Two arrested over cyber-attack on nursery chain
Man and teenage boy arrested over cyber-attack on London nurseries
summary: Hackers reportedly stole photos, names, and addresses of 8,000 children from the Kido nursery chain, posting 10 profiles online with threats to release more. A 22-year-old man and a 17-year-old boy have been arrested in Greater London in connection with the cyber-attack.

title: Tesla Launches More Affordable Model Y and Model 3 Variants
snippets: Tesla's Model Y standard SUV is priced just under $40,000 and Model 3 standard sedan around $37,000.
On Tuesday, the EV giant unveiled the long-awaited budget-friendly version of the Model Y, along with a cheaper Model 3.
titles: Tesla prices Model Y standard below $40,000, debuting more affordable vehicle
Tesla reveals its long-awaited more affordable models: the $36,990 Model 3 Standard and $39,990 Model Y Standard
summary: Tesla introduced a more affordable version of the Model Y SUV, priced just under $40,000, and a cheaper Model 3 sedan at approximately $37,000. These budget-friendly options were unveiled on Tuesday, expanding Tesla's electric vehicle offerings to a wider market.

title: Global Trade Surges in H1 2025 Amid Tariff Concerns
snippets: Global trade volumes rose sharply in the first half of 2025 as businesses front-loaded imports ahead of higher tariffs.
The World Trade Organization said trade growth had proved more resilient in 2025 than expected, but would slow next year as result of President Trump’s tariffs.
titles: WTO hikes global trade forecast for 2025 — but next year doesn't look so good
Global Trade Growth to Slow Sharply Next Year, W.T.O. Says
summary: In the first half of 2025, global trade volumes increased significantly as businesses accelerated imports in anticipation of higher tariffs. The World Trade Organization noted that trade growth in 2025 was more resilient than anticipated. However, it is expected to decelerate in the following year due to the implementation of tariffs by President Trump.

title: Filmmaker Says Late Father Would Disapprove of "TikTok Slop" AI Content
snippets: The filmmaker said it is not what her dad, who died in 2014, would have wanted.
Zelda Williams Williams’ post highlighted one of the ghoulish consequences of generative AI, and its ability to churn out photorealistic video—the emergence of digital necromancy.
titles: Robin Williams' daughter pleads for people to stop sending AI videos of her dad
Robin Williams’ Daughter Condemns AI-Generated Videos Of Her Father
summary: A filmmaker commented that her father, who passed away in 2014, would not have approved of "TikTok slop," a term referring to low-quality content produced by artificial intelligence and widely shared on social media platforms.

title: Lenders to Pay £8.2 Billion in Major Compensation Scheme

summary: Lenders are expected to pay out £8.2 billion in compensation, a figure lower than the Financial Conduct Authority's (FCA) initial estimate. Despite this reduction, it remains one of the largest compensation schemes in the industry's history.

title: Intercontinental Invests $2B in Polymarket, Stock Rises 3% in Premarket
snippets: Intercontinental Exchange rose more than 3% in the premarket after the company announced it took a $2 billion stake in prediction markets platform Polymarket.
The investment follows a previous venture round that reportedly valued the prediction market at more than $1 billion.

New York Stock Exchange parent company invests $2 billion in Polymarket at $9 billion valuation
summary: Intercontinental Exchange announced a $2 billion investment in Polymarket, a prediction markets platform founded by Shayne Coplan. Following the announcement, Intercontinental's stock rose over 3% in premarket trading.
